definition: to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need
cloud/CL:朵[duo3]
surname Yun/abbr. for Yunnan Province 雲南省|云南省[Yun2 nan2 Sheng3]
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

sentences.english: Yet it would be naive to expect Hillary-hatred to go away.
sentences.chinese: 但因此就期望對希拉里的反對煙消雲散就太天真了。

sentences.english: May you remember the good times and forget the sorrow and pain, for the good times will remin.
sentences.chinese: 願你銘記甜美幸福的時刻，讓悲傷和痛苦煙消雲散。

sentences.english: A stomach volume in the finishing woo vanished.
sentences.chinese: 一肚子火氣在刀刻斧削中煙消雲散。

sentences.english: You will be amazed how fast life's little troubles start to disappear.
sentences.chinese: 你將會很驚訝地發現生活中的小麻煩很快煙消雲散。

sentences.english: Christ can lift you out of depression. He can help you.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌可以讓抑鬱煙消雲散，他會幫助你，治癒你。

sentences.english: But watch it, or you may undermine your chances for raises and promotions.
sentences.chinese: 但這也有可能使你的提薪或提升機會煙消雲散。
一切疑慮現在都煙消雲散了。

sentences.english: You know, it really cleared the air for both of us.
sentences.chinese: 知道嗎，這真的使我們之間的誤會煙消雲散了。

sentences.english: All her imaginary happiness vanished in a moment.
sentences.chinese: 她想象中的幸福霎時全部煙消雲散了。

definition: to keep silent
to sweep clean/to clean out
scattered and smashed (idiom)
to forget
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
easy/with no difficulty
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
separated in life and death/to part for ever
relieved/at ease/feel relieved
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to bother/to disturb/to vex
to be obsessive/to persist obstinately
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
dejected/disheartened/listless
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
to dash (run fast)/to rush/to dart
